critique: The executive order seems to want to convey a sense of seriousness and urgency due to the 'present emergency conditions' and 'present international situation.' This suggests a degree of fear and perhaps a touch of sadness given the circumstances. There might also be a hint of surprise at the suddenness of the order. Joy and disgust don't seem to be relevant emotions in this context. The initial scores reflect this assessment, but the revised scores slightly increase the fear and sadness to emphasize the gravity of the situation.
